creator: N/A
headline: N/A
abstract:
The mountain lakes observatory focuses on 20 lakes located above 1800m a.s.l in order to follow the reply of theses ecosystems to global changes.
Data are available for lakes situated in nature reserves of Haute-Savoie (Anterne, Brévent, Cornu, Jovet, Pormenaz), in Vanoise National Park (Arpont, Blanc et Noir du Carro, Merlet, Mont Coua ), in Ecrins National Park (Muzelle, Pavé, Pétarel, Pisses, Plan-Vianney), in Mercantour National Park (Bressse inférieur, Bresse supérieur, Lauzanier), in lakes managed by the Centre d'ingénierie of EDF (Aumar, Corne,  Cos, Izourt, Rabuons) and by the Communauté de Communes Coeur de Maurienne Arvan (Bramant and Blanc).

Protocols are done every year in the same way on September in order to collect consistent data on all the lakes of the network on the following parameters: transparency, profiles on the water column, chemicals analysis, chlorophyll-a analysis, zooplankton and phytoplankton. These data are collected at the deeper point of the lake. The physical and chemical water analyses are done on two samples, one sample in the bottom of the lake and the other one at several depths in the euphotic zone. Phytoplankton analysis is also done on the sample from euphotic zone. A nest is used to sample all the water column for the zooplankton.
Lastly, data loggers are installed and measure continual data during the all year. Temperature sensors are installed at several depths and oxygen sensor is installed in the bottom of the lake.
For more information on protocols: www.lacs-sentinelles.org/fr/les-protocoles

For most of the lakes, data acquisition started in 2014. For some lakes, older data exist (since 1992) with uncertainties mainly on chemistry data and sometimes slightly different protocols.
Raw data collected on the field are stored on the information system of the Observatory of Lakes (SI-OLA), managed by the INRAE of Thonon-les-Bains, France. Data can be download after the creation of a usercount.
author: Christian Mougin
name: Sentinel lakes, Observatory of mountain lakes
distributionInfo: Commission Regulation (EU) No 1089/2010 of 23 November 2010 implementing Directive 2007/2/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council as regards interoperability of spatial data sets and services
